name: Slack Capabilities
description: Evaluation dataset for Slack subagent capabilities including messaging, channel management, user lookup, and workspace operations. Includes lazy queries, intentional mistakes, and ambiguous items.

items.input: send message to #general saying good morning team
items.expected_output: 1. Find channel #general. 2. Send message 'good morning team'.
items.context: User wants to send a simple channel message

items.input: dm john about the meeting at 3pm
items.expected_output: 1. Find user john. 2. Open/create DM conversation. 3. Send message about 3pm meeting.
items.context: User wants to send direct message

items.expected_output: Create new Slack channel named 'project-alpha'.
items.context: User wants to create a new channel

items.expected_output: Search channels by name/topic/purpose matching 'marketing'.
items.context: User wants to find marketing channel

items.input: add reaction üëç to the last message in #standup
items.expected_output: 1. Find #standup channel. 2. Get recent messages. 3. Add thumbsup reaction to latest message.
items.context: User wants to react to message

items.expected_output: 1. Find user by email sarah@company.com. 2. Find #engineers channel. 3. Invite user to channel.
items.context: User wants to add someone to channel

items.input: set my status to 'In a meeting' with üóìÔ∏è emoji
items.expected_output: Set user status with text 'In a meeting' and calendar emoji.
items.context: User wants to update status

items.expected_output: Clear the authenticated user's status.
items.context: User wants to remove status

items.expected_output: List conversations/channels where user is a member.
items.context: User wants to see their channels

items.expected_output: Search messages across workspace for 'quarterly budget'.
items.context: User wants to search message history

items.input: schedule message to #announcements for monday 9am saying 'Team meeting at 10am'
items.expected_output: Schedule message to #announcements channel for Monday 9am.
items.context: User wants to schedule a message

items.input: create a reminder to check emails in 30 minutes
items.expected_output: Create Slack reminder with text 'check emails' for 30 minutes from now.
items.context: User wants to set a reminder

items.expected_output: 1. Find #old-project channel. 2. Request user confirmation. 3. Archive the channel.
items.context: User wants to archive channel - needs consent

items.expected_output: List users and check presence status for active/away users.
items.context: User wants to see who's available

items.expected_output: Find user by name 'mike.smith' and retrieve profile information.
items.context: User wants user details

items.input: reply to the thread about deployment issues
items.expected_output: 1. Search messages for 'deployment issues'. 2. Find parent message/thread. 3. Reply in thread.
items.context: User wants to reply to specific thread

items.input: set channel topic for #team to 'Daily standups and updates'
items.expected_output: 1. Find #team channel. 2. Set channel topic.
items.context: User wants to update channel topic

items.expected_output: 1. Find user sarah. 2. Find #dev channel. 3. Search messages in channel from user.
items.context: User wants filtered message search

items.input: create user group @frontend-team with john and sarah
items.expected_output: 1. Find users john and sarah. 2. Create user group with name 'frontend-team' containing those users.
items.context: User wants to create a group

items.expected_output: List all reminders for authenticated user.
items.context: User wants to see reminders

items.expected_output: 1. List reminders. 2. Find reminder about report. 3. Confirm and delete.
items.context: User wants to delete reminder

items.input: pin the important message in #general about policy update
items.expected_output: 1. Find #general channel. 2. Search for message about policy update. 3. Pin message.
items.context: User wants to pin a message

items.expected_output: 1. Find #support channel. 2. Fetch conversation history.
items.context: User wants to see channel history

items.input: create a canvas called 'Q4 Planning Notes'
items.expected_output: Create new Slack canvas with title 'Q4 Planning Notes'.
items.context: User wants to create a canvas

items.expected_output: 1. Find #random channel. 2. Leave the channel.
items.context: User wants to leave a channel

items.expected_output: 1. Recognize 'slacc' as typo for 'slack'. 2. Find #team channel. 3. Ask for message content or send message.
items.context: User made typo in 'slack'

items.expected_output: 1. Find #engineering channel. 2. List channel members.
items.context: User wants channel member list

items.input: star the last message from boss in #leadership
items.expected_output: 1. Find #leadership channel. 2. Find recent message from 'boss'. 3. Add star to the message.
items.context: User wants to star a message

items.expected_output: 1. Find #proj-x channel. 2. Rename to 'project-x'.
items.context: User wants to rename channel

items.input: mark the reminder about standup as complete
items.expected_output: 1. List reminders. 2. Find reminder about standup. 3. Mark as complete.
items.context: User wants to complete a reminder
